title: AdaGReS:Adaptive Greedy Context Selection via Redundancy-Aware Scoring for Token-Budgeted RAG
summary: AdaGReS is a novel framework for token-budgeted Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) that addresses the issue of redundant context selection by optimizing a set-level objective combining query relevance and intra-set redundancy penalties. It employs greedy selection with an adaptively calibrated trade-off parameter, theoretically guaranteeing near-optimal context selection, which translates to improved answer quality and robustness across various domains, including biomedical. This framework significantly enhances the efficiency and reliability of RAG by ensuring high-quality, non-redundant contextual information.

title: Computational Analysis of Disease Progression in Pediatric Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
summary: This study developed and calibrated multi-scale, patient-specific cardiovascular models for pediatric Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (PAH) using longitudinal MRI and catheterization data. The computational models successfully captured patient-specific hemodynamic adaptation over time, with derived metrics aligning with clinical indicators of disease severity and progression, demonstrating a promising non-invasive monitoring tool.

title: MAMA-Memeia! Multi-Aspect Multi-Agent Collaboration for Depressive Symptoms Identification in Memes
summary: This paper introduces MAMAMemeia, a novel multi-agent multi-aspect collaborative framework, grounded in Cognitive Analytic Therapy (CAT) Competencies, for identifying depressive symptoms expressed through memes on social media. Utilizing the new RESTOREx dataset, which features LLM-generated and human-annotated explanations, MAMAMemeia significantly improves depressive symptom detection, surpassing the current state-of-the-art by 7.55% in macro-F1 and establishing a new benchmark among over 30 methods.
